column4: I'm trying to run  a program called stripe snoop and the executable named ss is in my file path but when I enter ./ss it tells me the file doesn't exist
did you try sudo ./ss
yeah I did
what is the extension of the file ie .sh .pl.
there is none
then leave off the ./ and just run ss see what happens
I have another program called ss that does something with networking and that executes
did you install build-essential
no, are there any other dependencies I should think about?
from the dir your compiling in sudo apt-get build-dep gettext
it should install the dependencies
I can't get the network settings working
you have no internet to install the dependencies?
exactly I installed kwlan and it screwed up and uninstalled network manager so I'm trying to compile it
do you have the install cd you used to install ubuntu?
heh no I'm away from home
if you could point me to a resource that shows me how to compile and find dependencies that'd be awesome
well build-essential will give you most of the default dependencies but each package has it's own requirements that's where build-dep comes in handy but hold on a sec
if your using karmic http://packages.ubuntu.com/karmic/network-manager
beauty thanks a lot
your welcome
